skill.name: decision-action
skill.description: Use when the user needs to choose, prioritize, or make a go/no-go decision among options.
skill.summary: Use when the user needs to choose, prioritize, or make a go/no-go decision among options.
skill.author: BellaBe

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based decision-making framework containing only documentation and guidelines. All 12 claimed static findings are false positives - the analyzer misidentified JSON field names (license, hash, tree) and documentation text as security threats. The pre-computed report correctly assessed this as safe with no risk factors.

content.value_statement: Complex decisions can feel overwhelming without a clear framework. This skill guides you through structured evaluation of options, making tradeoffs visible, and reaching confident recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Define clear decision statements with scope boundaries
Enumerate all options including status quo alternatives
Compare options against explicit weighted criteria
Provide clear recommendations with confidence levels
Identify risks and define revisit triggers
Structure decision rationale for stakeholder communication
limitations: Does not execute plans or track implementation progress
Does not provide ongoing monitoring of decision outcomes
Does not integrate with external data sources or APIs
Cannot make decisions on your behalf without your input

use_cases.title: Prioritize features
use_cases.description: Evaluate competing feature requests using weighted criteria like effort, impact, and customer demand

use_cases.title: Technology selection
use_cases.description: Compare technical options like frameworks, databases, or cloud providers with clear tradeoffs

use_cases.title: Go/no-go decisions
use_cases.description: Make investment decisions with explicit risk assessment and clear revisit triggers

prompt_templates.title: Basic decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Decide between [option A] and [option B]. Define the decision criteria, compare both options, make a clear recommendation, and state when we should reconsider.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-option selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me choose the best option from [list all options]. Include do nothing as an option. Use criteria like [list criteria with weights]. Recommend one option with rationale.

prompt_templates.title: Investment decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Make a go/no-go decision on [investment opportunity]. Define the decision scope, enumerate options, compare financial and strategic tradeoffs, state risks, and set revisit triggers.

prompt_templates.title: Team resource allocation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help our team prioritize between [list initiatives]. Define evaluation criteria important to [describe context], rank each initiative, recommend allocation, and flag any dependencies.

output_examples.input: Decide between AWS and Azure for our new data platform.
output: DECISION: Select AWS as primary cloud platform for data platform
OPTIONS EVALUATED: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Stay on-premise
CRITERIA USED: Cost (30%), Ecosystem (25%), Performance (20%), Team expertise (15%), Compliance (10%)
KEY TRADEOFFS: AWS has stronger data services but Azure integrates better with existing Microsoft stack
RISKS: Migration complexity, team retraining needs
REVISIT TRIGGERS: If Azure announces major data platform advances or if our Microsoft integration needs significantly increase

best_practices: Always include do nothing or status quo as a baseline option
Define evaluation criteria before comparing options to avoid bias
Set clear revisit triggers so decisions can be updated when conditions change
anti_patterns: Using this skill for execution planning instead of decision-making
Skipping explicit criteria and relying on intuition alone
Making decisions without defining when to revisit based on new information

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is compatible with any Anthropic-based AI assistant that supports skill definitions.

faq.question: How many options can this skill evaluate?
faq.answer: The skill can evaluate any number of options but performs best with 3-7 choices. More options should be pre-filtered to a manageable set.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my project management tools?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill. To integrate with tools, combine it with planning skills that can execute actions in your workflow systems.

faq.question: Is my decision data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No data leaves your session. The skill operates purely on the prompts you provide within your AI conversation context.

faq.question: Why is my decision different from the recommendation?
faq.answer: The skill provides recommendations based on explicit criteria you define. Your domain knowledge may weight factors differently. Use the framework but trust your judgment.

faq.question: How is this different from planning skills?
faq.answer: Decision skills help you CHOOSE between options. Planning skills help you EXECUTE after a decision is made. Use decision first, then planning.
